comments.body:
Attached ver.1 patch for review, it fixed:

1) Incompatible changes in GetClusterNodeLabelResponse.java (signature changed)

2) Configuration key variable name changed by HADOOP-12458

3) One of ContainerTokenIdentifier newInstance method removed

4) InvalidStateTransitionException changes from YARN-3381
(The exception class with name fixed should extend the old class).

Ping related folks:

[~jianhe], [~qwertymaniac], [~brahmareddy], [~ajisakaa], [~vinodkv] to review this patch.

Thanks!\

Please let me know about your thoughts.

Mostly looks good to me. I checked what issue broke the compatibility.

bq. 1) Incompatible changes in GetClusterNodeLabelResponse.java (signature changed)
YARN-3413 (fixed in 2.8.0)

bq. 3) One of ContainerTokenIdentifier newInstance method removed
YARN-2581 (fixed in 2.6.0)

I'm thinking we should separate the patch into (3) and the rest. (3) should be fixed in branch-2.6 and above.
Additional comment: Would you add javadoc to document the replacements when deprecating APIs?
Ping, seems like this patch is pretty close? Can we get it committed?

bq. Found that the getter/setter name is inconsistent, make it set/getNodeLabels ?
{{public abstract Set<NodeLabel> getNodeLabels()}} already exists, so we cannot make {{getNodeLabelsList()}} to {{getNodeLabels()}}. Instead, we can make {{setNodeLabels(List<NodeLabel>)}} to {{setNodeLabelsList(List<NodeLabel>)}}. What do you think?

bq. I still think we don't need to add back this config, it is only used by RM's own code, user code is not using this. your opinion ?
Agreed.

06 patch:
* Fixed javac and checkstyle warnings

bq. GetClusterNodeLabelsResponsePBImpl is not thread safe. Changing the implementation of the list to CopyOnWriteArrayList.
Detail: getNodeLabels method iterates {{updateNodeLabels}}, and setNodeLabelList method calls {{updateNodeLabels.addAll}}. If the two methods are called at the same time, ConcurrentModificationException can happen.
